#summary How to to install the http-proxy with Roo 1.1.0.M3 shell

===How to install http-proxy Spring Roo Addon===

 * Uninstall the older addon versions
{{{
  roo> osgi uninstall --bundleSymbolicName net.tzolov.http.servletproxy.roo.addon
}}}
 * Install the addon directly from the googlecode site
{{{ 
  roo> felix shell start http://spring-roo-addons.googlecode.com/files/net.tzolov.http.servletproxy.roo.addon-0.1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar
}}}
  Alternatively you can download the http://spring-roo-addons.googlecode.com/files/net.tzolov.http.servletproxy.roo.addon-0.1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar net.tzolov.http.servletproxy.roo.addon] and install it from your local folder:
{{{
  roo> felix shell start file:/<absolute path>/net.tzolov.http.servletproxy.roo.addon-0.1.2-SNAPSHOT.jar
}}}
 * Verify the installation:
{{{
  roo> osgi ps 
}}}
 * You should see something like:
{{{
[  90] [Active     ] [    1] net.tzolov.http.servletproxy.roo.addon (0.1.2.SNAPSHOT)
}}}
 * From the Roo Shell type *help* to see the list of all supported commands. The following line should appear amongst others entries:
{{{
roo> help http-proxy
* http-proxy add - Add new ServletProxy configuration
* http-proxy cleanAll - Remove all existing ServletProxy configurations
* http-proxy list - Shows the existing ServletProxy configurations
* http-proxy remove - Remove an existing ServletProxy configuration
}}}
